articles.title: Qualcomm acquires chip designer Alphawave for $2.4B
articles.summary: Qualcomm Inc. is acquiring U.K.-based chip interconnect provider Alphawave IP Group plc for $2.4 billion, a deal intended to boost Qualcomm's share of the data center chip market. Alphawave's technology, including AresCORE and GammaCORE, will complement Qualcomm's Oryon CPU series and Hexagon NPUs, particularly in areas like co-packaged optics for data centers. The acquisition, expected to close in Q1 2026, aims to enhance Qualcomm's offerings for advanced computing performance in high-growth sectors.

articles.title: Nasdaq-listed Oblong jumps 12%, eyes $7.5M Bittensor TAO acquisition for Bitcoin-style treasury strategy
articles.summary: Nasdaq-listed Oblong has announced plans to raise $7.5 million through a private stock sale to fund a new initiative focused on Bittensor's AI and digital asset treasury. This strategic move, which has already seen Oblong's shares jump 12%, aims to acquire TAO tokens and support the Bittensor AI marketplace, reflecting the company's belief in the transformative potential of decentralized AI. Oblong likens its approach to how institutional players adopted Bitcoin as a treasury asset, viewing TAO as a key asset for the future of AI-integrated crypto infrastructure.

articles.title: New IVES ETF Uses Dan Ives’ Research Framework
articles.summary: Wedbush Fund Advisors has launched the Dan Ives Wedbush AI Revolution ETF (IVES), designed to offer long-term returns through a concentrated portfolio of AI companies. The ETF leverages the research framework of Dan Ives, Wedbush Securities' Managing Director and Global Head of Technology Research, to identify and invest in the top 30 companies driving AI innovation. IVES maintains a balanced portfolio, with no single company accounting for more than 6% of the overall weight, providing a diversified approach to AI exposure.

articles.title: 2 Unstoppable ETFs for Growth Investors to Buy and Hold for Years
articles.summary: This article highlights two ETFs for growth investors: the iShares Exponential Technologies ETF (NASDAQ: XT) and the Invesco QQQ Trust (NASDAQ: QQQ). The iShares ETF focuses on innovation leaders globally, offering broad exposure to growth stocks across various sectors, while the Invesco QQQ Trust tracks the top 100 non-financial stocks on the Nasdaq, with significant holdings in high-performing tech giants like Microsoft, Nvidia, and Apple, leading to strong past returns. Both are presented as long-term investment options for growth.

articles.title: 2 Unstoppable ETFs for Growth Investors to Buy and Hold for Years
articles.summary: This article highlights two ETFs, the iShares Exponential Technologies ETF (XT) and Invesco QQQ Trust (QQQ), as promising long-term investments for growth investors. XT diversifies across global innovation leaders with a modest expense ratio, while QQQ tracks the top 100 non-financial Nasdaq stocks, offering higher concentration in influential tech giants like Microsoft, Nvidia, and Apple. Both ETFs are presented as "buy and forget" options for potentially market-beating returns.

articles.title: New IVES ETF Uses Dan Ives’ Research Framework
articles.summary: Wedbush Fund Advisors has launched the Dan Ives Wedbush AI Revolution ETF (IVES), offering investors exposure to leading AI companies through a concentrated portfolio. The ETF leverages Dan Ives' research framework, focusing on top companies in AI software, cloud infrastructure, and semiconductors, while maintaining a balanced approach to mitigate risks presented by individual stock performance. This new fund aims to provide direct and meaningful exposure to the artificial intelligence sector, a transformative force in the global economy.

articles.title: New IVES ETF Uses Dan Ives’ Research Framework
articles.summary: The Dan Ives Wedbush AI Revolution ETF (IVES) has been launched by Wedbush Fund Advisors, leveraging the research framework of Dan Ives, Wedbush Securities' Managing Director and Global Head of Technology Research. The ETF provides concentrated exposure to AI companies, aiming for long-term returns through a tactically balanced portfolio that includes leaders like Microsoft, Nvidia, and Broadcom. IVES seeks to offer investors direct and meaningful access to the companies driving the AI revolution while mitigating individual company risk.

articles.title: KraneShares Launches First Humanoid Robot ETF
articles.summary: KraneShares has launched KOID, the first US-listed ETF specifically targeting humanoid robot companies. The fund tracks 50 companies across six categories, including prominent firms like Nvidia, Tesla, and Amphenol, using an equal-weighting strategy. KOID charges a 0.69% expense ratio after a fee waiver and aims to provide exposure to the global humanoid robotics opportunity.

articles.title: REX Financial Expands Growth & Income ETF Suite with New Single-Stock Covered Call Strategies on MSTR, COIN, and TSLA
articles.summary: REX Financial has expanded its Growth & Income Covered Call ETF suite by introducing three new funds: REX COIN Growth & Income ETF (COII), REX MSTR Growth & Income ETF (MSII), and REX TSLA Growth & Income ETF (TSII). These new ETFs aim to provide investors with weekly income generation and targeted exposure to Coinbase, Strategy (MicroStrategy), and Tesla, building on the recent launch of the REX NVDA Growth & Income ETF (NVII). The funds target daily exposure of 1.25x to their underlying stock while generating income through the strategic sale of call options, offering both uncapped upside potential and volatility monetization.

articles.title: The Dan Ives Wedbush AI Revolution ETF Starts Trading Today. Should You Buy the IVES ETF Now?
articles.summary: Wedbush senior analyst Dan Ives has launched the "Dan Ives Wedbush AI Revolution ETF" (ticker: IVES) to offer investors targeted exposure to his top 30 AI stock picks, including Nvidia and Tesla. Ives describes the ETF as a "living organism" that will be reconfigured quarterly to adapt to the evolving AI landscape. The fund aims to capitalize on the ongoing AI revolution, which Ives believes is still in its early stages and expanding beyond chips into software and consumer applications.

articles.title: FDG: A High Volatility, Premium Valuation Growth ETF (NYSEARCA:FDG)
articles.summary: The American Century Focused Dynamic Growth ETF (FDG) is characterized as a high-volatility, premium-valuation growth ETF with a concentrated portfolio focused on mega-cap tech, consumer discretionary, and healthcare. Despite its strong performance in bull markets, the fund exhibits limited diversification, higher costs, and lower liquidity compared to competitors, leading to underperformance and steeper drawdowns in downturns. The author maintains a neutral rating on FDG due to its elevated risk, premium valuation (28.8x earnings), and inconsistent long-term returns.

articles.title: Golden Eagle Strategies Plans New ETF Targeting High-Growth Stocks During Tech Rebound
articles.summary: Golden Eagle Strategies has filed with the SEC to launch a new actively managed ETF, the Golden Eagle Dynamic Hypergrowth ETF, focusing on companies with at least 40% year-over-year growth. The ETF, with an expense ratio of 0.85%, aims to capitalize on the recent rebound in the tech sector, which follows a period of market languish. Expected to debut in mid-August 2025, the fund targets investors seeking exposure to innovation-driven, high-growth businesses.

articles.title: Harte Hanks stock hits 52-week low at $4.24 amid market challenges
articles.summary: Harte Hanks Inc. (NASDAQ: HHS) stock has fallen to a 52-week low of $4.24 amidst challenging market conditions, despite analysts considering it undervalued with a target of $17.50. The marketing services company has experienced a significant 38.74% decline over the past year and reported a negative EBITDA of $28.35M, though it maintains a healthy current ratio and a negative beta. Recent corporate developments include the election of new board members, approval of executive compensation, and a cooperation agreement with major shareholders to ensure stability and investor confidence.

articles.title: Why This High-Yield, 12% Dividend ETF Is a Must-Own Stock
articles.summary: The NEOS S&P 500 High Income ETF (SPYI) offers investors a unique blend of potential share-price appreciation tied to the S&P 500, a high monthly dividend yield of over 12% generated through options strategies, and favorable tax treatment on capital gains. This combination makes it a compelling option for investors seeking both income and growth, particularly for those looking to leverage compounding and minimize short-term capital gains taxes. The ETF achieves its high income by investing in S&P 500 components and selling covered call options.

articles.title: GlobalFoundries Inc.'s (NASDAQ:GFS) Price Is Out Of Tune With Revenues
articles.summary: GlobalFoundries Inc.'s (NASDAQ:GFS) current price-to-sales (P/S) ratio of 3x is considered moderate within the Semiconductor industry, despite the company's recent revenue decline of 4.4% and an overall 4.5% drop over the last three years. Analysts forecast a modest 7.8% annual revenue growth for GlobalFoundries over the next three years, significantly lower than the industry's projected 24% growth. This disparity raises questions about why the market is not negatively impacting GFS's P/S ratio more, potentially indicating an overvaluation given its limited growth expectations.

articles.title: REX Financial launches covered call Nvidia ETF hours before earnings release
articles.summary: REX Financial has launched the REX NVDA Growth & Income ETF, a single-stock exchange-traded fund tied to Nvidia, just hours before Nvidia's earnings release. This covered call ETF uses option strategies to generate income and offers investors exposure to a portion of Nvidia's stock price upside, aiming to provide a balance of growth and income. The move targets self-directed individual investors seeking alternative income-generating products.

articles.title: Semiconductor ETF options show caution ahead of Nvidia results
articles.summary: Options traders are showing increased caution ahead of Nvidia's earnings report, with defensive put options on the VanEck Semiconductor ETF (SMH) seeing heavy trading. While there's hedging in the SMH ETF, Nvidia's individual options trading is more mixed, with some investors selling options to capitalize on heightened volatility expectations. This suggests a nuanced approach by traders, balancing sector-wide concern with specific bets on Nvidia's post-earnings reaction.

articles.title: REX Financial launches covered call Nvidia ETF hours before earnings release
articles.summary: REX Financial has launched the REX NVDA Growth & Income ETF, a single-stock exchange-traded fund tied to Nvidia, just hours before Nvidia's earnings release. This covered call ETF uses option strategies to generate income and offers investors exposure to Nvidia's stock upside. The fund aims to provide investors with a comfortable risk profile and weekly income from Nvidia options, appealing to those looking for alternative income-generating products.

articles.title: NVIDIA Announces Financial Results for First Quarter Fiscal 2026
articles.summary: NVIDIA reported strong first-quarter fiscal 2026 results with revenue of $44.1 billion, up 69% year-over-year, despite incurring a $4.5 billion charge due to new H20 export licensing requirements for China. The company's Data Center revenue surged to $39.1 billion, driven by robust demand for its AI infrastructure, including the Blackwell NVL72 AI supercomputer. NVIDIA also provided an optimistic outlook for Q2 fiscal 2026, anticipating $45.0 billion in revenue, even with an estimated $8.0 billion loss in H20 revenue.

articles.title: Nvidia Back in Focus and AI Infrastructure Acceleration
articles.summary: This article analyzes Nvidia's recent earnings call, highlighting the accelerating pace of innovation and capital expenditure in the semiconductor and AI infrastructure sectors. It emphasizes the shift from Nvidia being the sole focus to a broader ecosystem including fabless designers and custom silicon, suggesting diversified exposure through ETFs like SMH and SMHX is crucial for investors. The continued surge in AI adoption and associated compute demand underscores the long-term potential of the semiconductor industry.

articles.title: 2 Unstoppable ETFs for Growth Investors to Buy and Hold for Years
articles.summary: This article highlights two exchange-traded funds (ETFs), the iShares Exponential Technologies ETF (NASDAQ: XT) and Invesco QQQ Trust (NASDAQ: QQQ), as promising long-term investments for growth-oriented investors. The iShares ETF focuses on innovation leaders globally with a diversified portfolio, while the Invesco QQQ Trust tracks the top 100 non-financial stocks on the Nasdaq, offering higher exposure to individual high-performing tech giants. Both ETFs are presented as suitable for investors seeking to "buy and forget" due to their potential for market-beating returns.

articles.title: aethlon medical announces reverse stock split effective june 6
articles.summary: Aethlon Medical Inc. (NASDAQ: AEMD) will implement a 1-for-8 reverse stock split of its common stock, effective June 6, 2025, with trading on an adjusted basis commencing June 9, 2025. This decision, approved by stockholders, aims to consolidate shares without altering par value or percentage ownership, except for fractional share rounding. The company also recently completed a warrant inducement agreement, raising approximately $2.316 million for working capital.

articles.title: KraneShares Launches U.S. First Humanoid Robot ETF
articles.summary: KraneShares has launched the KraneShares Global Humanoid and Embodied Intelligence Index ETF (KOID), the first U.S. ETF focused on humanoid robotics, trading on the Nasdaq. This ETF aims to capture growth in the humanoid robot market, which Morgan Stanley projects could reach over $5 trillion by 2050. KOID offers exposure to the entire ecosystem of humanoid robot development, including manufacturing, AI integration, and critical components.

articles.title: REX Launches 3 New Growth & Income Covered Call ETFs
articles.summary: REX Financial has introduced three new "Growth & Income Covered Call ETFs" (COII, MSII, TSII) targeting Coinbase, MicroStrategy, and Tesla, respectively. These ETFs aim to provide growth potential and weekly income through a dual portfolio strategy, writing call options on approximately half of the portfolio while maintaining uncapped upside potential on the remainder. This launch expands on their recently released NVIDIA-focused fund, catering to investor demand for income-generating products tied to high-growth companies.

articles.title: GlobalFoundries boosts investment plans to $16 billion, with research focus
articles.summary: GlobalFoundries announced plans to increase its investment to $16 billion, allocating an additional $1 billion to capital spending and $3 billion to research in emerging chip technologies. This expansion is driven by the booming artificial intelligence hardware market and is expected to support factory expansions in New York and Vermont, as well as significant research in chip packaging, silicon photonics, and gallium nitride. The company is also collaborating with the Trump administration to fortify the U.S. chip manufacturing supply chain.

articles.title: Will the MAG 7 Stocks Continue to Lead the Stock Market?
articles.summary: The article discusses the continued influence of the "Magnificent Seven" (MAG 7) stocks—Microsoft, NVIDIA, Apple, Amazon, Alphabet, Meta Platforms, and Tesla—on the US stock market. It highlights their market capitalization leadership and their resilience following a market correction caused by tariff fears. The author suggests that the MAGS ETF offers a diversified way to invest in these leading technology companies and expects them to maintain their market leadership.

articles.title: Synopsys forecasts quarterly revenue largely above estimates
articles.summary: Synopsys forecasted third-quarter revenue largely above Wall Street estimates due to strong demand for its semiconductor design software, driven by increased spending on AI chips. The company's shares rose despite a media report about potential U.S. export restrictions to China, which Synopsys stated it had not received notice of. The company also addresses regulatory concerns regarding its $35 billion merger with Ansys.

articles.title: Is iShares Semiconductor ETF (SOXX) a Strong ETF Right Now?
articles.summary: The iShares Semiconductor ETF (SOXX), launched on July 10, 2001, is a smart beta ETF focusing on the Technology ETFs category, specifically tracking the PHLX SOX Semiconductor Sector Index. With over $11.83 billion in assets and an expense ratio of 0.35%, it offers concentrated exposure to the Information Technology sector, with top holdings including Broadcom Inc. and Nvidia Corp. As of May 28, 2025, SOXX has experienced a -2.76% year-to-date loss and a -11.65% loss over the last year, indicating a high-risk investment option within its segment.

articles.title: Semiconductor ETF options show caution ahead of Nvidia results
articles.summary: Options traders are showing caution ahead of Nvidia's earnings report, with significant defensive trading seen in the VanEck Semiconductor ETF (SMH). Put options on the SMH ETF have been heavily traded, suggesting concerns about sector-wide volatility. While some investors are hedging in SMH, others are selling Nvidia options to capitalize on heightened volatility expectations.

articles.title: NVDY: Attractive Into Nvidia's Q1 Report, With Stock +50% From The April Low
articles.summary: This article reiterates a buy rating on the YieldMax NVDA Option Income Strategy ETF (NVDY), citing its high option income potential. Despite underperforming NVDA and having a high expense ratio, NVDY's yield, sourced from call option selling, is compelling given NVIDIA's valuation and upcoming Q1 results. The author suggests NVDY offers an attractive risk/reward for income-focused investors, especially as NVIDIA approaches its earnings report.

articles.title: Mag 7 ETFs Surge: Will the Rally Keep Rolling?
articles.summary: The Magnificent Seven stocks saw a significant rally in May, collectively gaining over 13%, driven by strong earnings growth, the AI boom, and their defensive characteristics. This surge led to a 10% increase in the Roundhill Magnificent Seven ETF (MAGS) over the past month. Despite the solid performance, challenges such as rising valuations and increased capital expenditures for AI infrastructure could impact future profitability.

articles.title: Is iShares MSCI ACWI Low Carbon Target ETF (CRBN) a Strong ETF Right Now?
articles.summary: The article analyzes the iShares MSCI ACWI Low Carbon Target ETF (CRBN), highlighting its performance, risk profile, and smart beta strategy. It details the fund's expense ratio, top holdings, and year-to-date gains, concluding that it's a reasonable option for investors in the World ETFs segment. The article also suggests alternative ETFs for consideration.

articles.title: Hedge Fund and Insider Trading News: Ray Dalio, David Tepper, Warren Buffett, Bill Ackman, Saba Capital Management, Impactive Capital, Lakeland Financial Corp (LKFN), Tesla Inc (TSLA), and More
articles.summary: This article compiles recent news related to prominent hedge fund managers like Ray Dalio, David Tepper, and Warren Buffett, alongside updates on insider trading activities. Key mentions include Bill Ackman selling a railway stock to buy a Mag Seven stock, Saba Capital Management reaching an agreement with an investment trust, and significant insider sales at Tesla Inc (TSLA) by Kimbal Musk and Ira Ehrenpreis. The report also highlights a warning from an investor who predicted the 2008 crash concerning a particular Donald Trump policy.
